action.content:
Things are in different places, but the questioner does not know about it yet. Here is the situation:

WHAT: Things at places
LEFT: piano
RIGHT: hand saw
TOP: tulip
BOTTOM: ruler
CENTER: aluminium
NORTHWEST: carnation
NORTHEAST: highlighter
SOUTHWEST: blush
SOUTHEAST: lyre
HERE: jeans skirt
THERE: blueberry
NOWHERE: eye shadow
EVERYWHERE: flip-flops
INSIDE: hiking boots
OUTSIDE: post-it notes

Questions from the questioner will start with QUESTIONER. Please reply in the form: ANSWER: <some text>

I will also ask you questions. These questions will start with ME: . Please answer these questions with: ASIDE: <some text>

Important: Give short, direct answers!

Let us start.
Begin probing
ME:  Does the questioner know what is on your left? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that a piano is on my left.

ME:  Is the questioner asking about the things at places? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner is asking about the things at places.

WHAT: Things at places
LEFT: piano
RIGHT: hand saw
TOP: tulip
BOTTOM: ruler
CENTER: aluminium
NOR
NA

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that the piano is on my left.

ME: Thank you. Now, I have another question. Is the hand saw on your right? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the hand saw is on my right.

ME: You're welcome. That's all for now.

ASIDE: You're welcome.
NA

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that a piano is on my left.

ME: Now, please ask the questioner if they know what is on their right. Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that a hand saw is on their right.

ME: Thank you. Now, I have a question for the questioner. Does the questioner know what is on top
NA
ME: Please be specific now. Does the questioner know what is on your left? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows what is on their left.

ME: Is the questioner now aware of what is on their right? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows what is on their right.

ME: Is the questioner now aware of what is on the top? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Y
NA
ME: Please think about it carefully. Does the questioner know what is on your left? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that the piano is on their left.

ME: Is the questioner now aware of the hand saw on their right? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that the hand saw is on their right.

ME: Is the questioner aware of the tulip on the top? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.
NA

End probing

Game finished.
